bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Staten of Oregon, ) County of Multnomah: ss

I, Moy Wah, being first duly sworn says:- That I am and have been for six years last past a resident of Portland, Oregon; that I am a chinese merchant, and a member of the firm of Gum Wing Chung & Co. that the said firm are Chinese merchants duing business at No. 168 Fifth Street, Portland, Oregon.

That I am about to depart from the United States on business con- nected with my firm, and this cer- tificate is made for the purpose of assisting me to land on my re- turn; that the annexed photograph is of myself, and this certi- ficate will not be used by any other person.
Subscribed and sworen to before me this Twenty-second (22) day of January, A.D. 1892.
(sgd) J. E. Marks, Notary Public for Oregon.

We, the undersigned residents of Portland, Oregon here- by certify, that weare acquainted with Moy Wah of the firm of Gum Wing Chung & Co., and whose photograph is attached to the annexed paper; the said firm, Gum Wing Chung & Co., is at this time duing buisness at No. 168 Fifth street, Portland, Oregon.

That we beliebe the said Moy Wah is about to depart from the United States and this certificate is made for the purpose of as- sisting him to identify himself to the Custom House officers on his return to the United States.
State of Oregon, County of Multnomah.
I, Frank G. Harrington, being first duly sworn says, that certificate, No. 5183 (in blue), dated the 22 day of January, 1892, with my signature, was signed by me.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 4th day of may, 1893
State of Oregon, County of Multnomah.

I, Yee Bing being first duly sworn say that I belong to the firm of Gum Wing Chung & Co., and that I have a partner by the name of Moy Wah and that he went to China about the first of last year and the certificate attached to certificate No. 5183, dated the 22 day of January, 1892 is a good likeness of Moy Wah, my partner.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 4th day of May, 1893
Notarial Seal of J. E. Marks.
